info.title: Monitoring API reference
info.description:
Configure and manage Event, Stats, Logging, Alerts, Mirror Sessions
and other monitoring policies.

 API Objects are: Alert AlertDestination AlertPolicy ArchiveRequest EventPolicy FlowExportPolicy FwlogPolicy MirrorSession StatsPolicy TechSupportRequest TroubleshootingSession

parameters.name: O.name
parameters.description: Name of the object, unique within a Namespace for scoped objects. Must start and end with alpha numeric and can have alphanumeric, -, _, . Length of string should be between 2 and 64.

parameters.name: O.tenant
parameters.description: Tenant to which the object belongs to. This can be automatically filled in many cases based on the tenant the user, who created the object, belongs to. Must be alpha-numerics. Length of string should be between 1 and 48.

parameters.name: O.namespace
parameters.description: Namespace of the object, for scoped objects. Must start and end with alpha numeric and can have alphanumeric, -, _, . Length of string should be between 2 and 64.

parameters.name: O.generation-id
parameters.description: GenerationID is the generation Id for the object. This is incremented anytime there is an update to the user intent, including Spec update and any update to ObjectMeta. System generated and updated, not updatable by user.

parameters.name: O.resource-version
parameters.description: Resource version in the object store. This is updated anytime there is any change to the object. System generated and updated, not updatable by user.

parameters.name: O.uuid
parameters.description: UUID is the unique identifier for the object. This is generated on creation of the object. System generated, not updatable by user.

parameters.name: O.creation-time
parameters.description: CreationTime is the creation time of the object. System generated and updated, not updatable by user.

parameters.name: O.mod-time
parameters.description: ModTime is the Last Modification time of the object. System generated and updated, not updatable by user.

parameters.name: O.self-link
parameters.description: SelfLink is a link for accessing this object. When the object is served from the API-GW it is the URI path. Example: - "/v1/tenants/tenants/tenant2" System generated and updated, not updatable by user.

parameters.name: label-selector
parameters.description: LabelSelector to select on labels in list or watch results.

parameters.name: field-selector
parameters.description: FieldSelector to select on field values in list or watch results.

parameters.name: field-change-selector
parameters.description: FieldChangeSelector specifies to generate a watch notification on change in field(s) specified.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: from represents the start offset (zero based), used for pagination. results returned would be in the range [from ... from+max-results-1].

parameters.name: max-results
parameters.description: max. number of events to be fetched for the request.

parameters.name: sort-order
parameters.description: order to sort List results in.

parameters.name: T.kind
parameters.description: Kind represents the type of the API object.

parameters.name: T.api-version
parameters.description: APIVersion defines the version of the API object. This can only be set by the server.

parameters.name: spec.packet-size
parameters.description: PacketSize: Max size of a mirrored packet. PacketSize = 0 indicates complete packet is mirrored, except when mirrored packets are sent to Venice. For packets mirrored to Venice, max mirror packet size allowed is 256 B.

parameters.name: source.ip-addresses
parameters.description: Each IPAddress can be single address(10.1.1.1)/range(10.1.1.10-20)/subnet(10.1.0.0/16).

parameters.name: source.mac-addresses
parameters.description: List of MacAddresses - "aabb.ccdd.eeff", "0001.0203.0405". Should be a valid MAC address.

parameters.name: destination.ip-addresses
parameters.description: Each IPAddress can be single address(10.1.1.1)/range(10.1.1.10-20)/subnet(10.1.0.0/16).

parameters.name: destination.mac-addresses
parameters.description: List of MacAddresses - "aabb.ccdd.eeff", "0001.0203.0405". Should be a valid MAC address.

parameters.name: app-protocol-selectors.proto-ports
parameters.description: ports - Includes protocol name and port Eg ["tcp/1234", "udp"]. Should be a valid layer 3 or layer 4 protocol and port/type.

parameters.name: app-protocol-selectors.applications
parameters.description: Apps - E.g. ["Redis"].

parameters.name: time-window.start-time
parameters.description: Start/Stop Time - when start time is not specified, it implies start NOW.

parameters.name: time-window.stop-time
parameters.description: Stop time - when not specified, default will be used.

parameters.name: spec.enable-mirroring
parameters.description: If packet capture is enabled, a mirror-session will be internally created.

parameters.name: spec.resource
parameters.description: Resource type - target resource to run this policy. e.g. Network, Endpoint - object based alert policy Event - event based alert policy EndpointMetrics - metric based alert policy based on the resource type, the policy gets interpreted.

parameters.name: spec.severity
parameters.description: Severity to be set for an alert that gets triggered from this rule.

parameters.name: spec.message
parameters.description: Message to be used while generating the alert XXX: Event based alerts should not carry a message. It will be derived from the event.

parameters.name: spec.persistence-duration
parameters.description: Met rule (requirements) needs to sustain for the given duration to qualify to be an alert.

parameters.name: spec.clear-duration
parameters.description: Met rule (requirements) needs to be cleared for the given duration to resolve an alert.

parameters.name: spec.enable
parameters.description: User can disable the policy by setting this field. Disabled policies will not generate any more alerts but the outstanding ones will remain as is.

parameters.name: spec.auto-resolve
parameters.description: If set, the underlying alert will be auto-resolved if the rule that triggered the alert is cleared.

parameters.name: spec.destinations
parameters.description: name of the alert destinations to be used to send out notification when an alert gets generated.

parameters.name: status.total-hits
parameters.description: Total hits on this policy.

parameters.name: status.open-alerts
parameters.description: Open alerts based on this policy.

parameters.name: status.acknowledged-alerts
parameters.description: Acknowledged alerts based on this policy.

parameters.description: Resource type - target resource to run this policy. e.g. Network, Endpoint - object based alert policy Event - event based alert policy EndpointMetrics - metric based alert policy based on the resource type, the policy gets interpreted.

parameters.description: Severity to be set for an alert that gets triggered from this rule.

parameters.description: Message to be used while generating the alert XXX: Event based alerts should not carry a message. It will be derived from the event.

parameters.name: spec.persistence-duration
parameters.description: Met rule (requirements) needs to sustain for the given duration to qualify to be an alert.

parameters.name: spec.clear-duration
parameters.description: Met rule (requirements) needs to be cleared for the given duration to resolve an alert.

parameters.name: spec.enable
parameters.description: User can disable the policy by setting this field. Disabled policies will not generate any more alerts but the outstanding ones will remain as is.

parameters.name: spec.auto-resolve
parameters.description: If set, the underlying alert will be auto-resolved if the rule that triggered the alert is cleared.

parameters.name: spec.destinations
parameters.description: name of the alert destinations to be used to send out notification when an alert gets generated.

parameters.name: status.total-hits
parameters.description: Total hits on this policy.

parameters.name: status.open-alerts
parameters.description: Open alerts based on this policy.

parameters.description: Acknowledged alerts based on this policy.

parameters.name: spec.retention-time
parameters.description: RetentionTime defines for how long to keep the stats data before it is deleted The value is specified as a string format to be hours, days, or months etc. e.g. '24hrs', '72hours', '4days', '6d', '2months', '4mo', '1yr' Default is 48h. Should be a valid time duration.

parameters.name: spec.downsample-retention-time
parameters.description: DownSampleRetentionTime defines for how long to keep the down sampled data before it is deleted The value is specified as a string format to be hours, days, or months etc. e.g. '24hrs', '72hours', '4days', '6d', '2months', '4mo', '1yr' Default is 168h. Should be a valid time duration.

type_url.description: A URL/resource name whose content describes the type of the serialized protocol buffer message. For URLs which use the scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, the following restrictions and interpretations apply: * If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed. * The last segment of the URL's path must represent the fully qualified name of the type (as in `path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form (e.g., leading "." is not accepted). * An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][] value in binary format, or produce an error. * Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage breaking changes.) Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be used with implementation specific semantics.

value.description: Must be a valid serialized protocol buffer of the above specified type.

googleprotobufAny.description: `Any` contains an arbitrary serialized protocol buffer message along with a URL that describes the type of the serialized message. Protobuf library provides support to pack/unpack Any values in the form of utility functions or additional generated methods of the Any type. Example 1: Pack and unpack a message in C++. Foo foo = ...; Any any; any.PackFrom(foo); ... if (any.UnpackTo(&foo)) { ... } Example 2: Pack and unpack a message in Java. Foo foo = ...; Any any = Any.pack(foo); ... if (any.is(Foo.class)) { foo = any.unpack(Foo.class); } Example 3: Pack and unpack a message in Python. foo = Foo(...) any = Any() any.Pack(foo) ... if any.Is(Foo.DESCRIPTOR): any.Unpack(foo) ... Example 4: Pack and unpack a message in Go foo := &pb.Foo{...} any, err := ptypes.MarshalAny(foo) ... foo := &pb.Foo{} if err := ptypes.UnmarshalAny(any, foo); err != nil { ... } The pack methods provided by protobuf library will by default use 'type.googleapis.com/full.type.name' as the type URL and the unpack methods only use the fully qualified type name after the last '/' in the type URL, for example "foo.bar.com/x/y.z" will yield type name "y.z". JSON ==== The JSON representation of an `Any` value uses the regular representation of the deserialized, embedded message, with an additional field `@type` which contains the type URL. Example: package google.profile; message Person { string first_name = 1; string last_name = 2; } { "@type": "type.googleapis.com/google.profile.Person", "firstName": <string>, "lastName": <string> } If the embedded message type is well-known and has a custom JSON representation, that representation will be embedded adding a field `value` which holds the custom JSON in addition to the `@type` field. Example (for message [google.protobuf.Duration][]): { "@type": "type.googleapis.com/google.protobuf.Duration", "value": "1.212s" }.

key.description: The label key that the condition applies to.

values.description: Values contains one or more values corresponding to the label key. "equals" and "notEquals" operators need a single Value. "in" and "notIn" operators can have one or more values.

labelsRequirement.description: Requirement defines a single matching condition for a selector.

labelsSelector.description: Selector is used to select objects by labels. Requirements in the selector are ANDed. A selector with no Requirements does not select anything.

monitoringAlertDestinationList.description: AlertDestinationList is a container object for list of AlertDestination objects.

selector.description: export alerts matched by the selector.

total-notifications-sent.description: total number of notifications sent using this notification mechanism.

monitoringAlertList.description: AlertList is a container object for list of Alert objects.

monitoringAlertPolicyList.description: AlertPolicyList is a container object for list of AlertPolicy objects.

resource.description: Resource type - target resource to run this policy. e.g. Network, Endpoint - object based alert policy Event - event based alert policy EndpointMetrics - metric based alert policy based on the resource type, the policy gets interpreted.

severity.description: Severity to be set for an alert that gets triggered from this rule.

message.description: Message to be used while generating the alert XXX: Event based alerts should not carry a message. It will be derived from the event.

requirements.description: List of requirements that needs to be met to trigger an alert.

persistence-duration.description: Met rule (requirements) needs to sustain for the given duration to qualify to be an alert.

clear-duration.description: Met rule (requirements) needs to be cleared for the given duration to resolve an alert.

enable.description: User can disable the policy by setting this field. Disabled policies will not generate any more alerts but the outstanding ones will remain as is.

auto-resolve.description: If set, the underlying alert will be auto-resolved if the rule that triggered the alert is cleared.

destinations.description: name of the alert destinations to be used to send out notification when an alert gets generated.

open-alerts.description: Open alerts based on this policy.

acknowledged-alerts.description: Acknowledged alerts based on this policy.

matched-requirements.description: List of requirements from the alert policy with it's matched value.

monitoringAlertReason.description: AlertReason captures all the requirements with matched value from the alert policy rule at the time of creating an alert. e.g. "matched-requirements": [{"field": "cpu", "operator": "Gt", "values": [90], "observed-value": 95}].

monitoringAlertSource.description: Source of an alert; for alerts generated from events, it maps to event.Source.

monitoringAlertSpec.description: User can change the state of the alert by changing the spec.

message.description: Message from the alert rule that triggered the alert.

reason.description: Captures all the requirements from the alert policy rule with matched value. All these requirements must be cleared to auto-resolve an alert.

acknowledged.description: Username and time at which the alert was acknowledged.

resolved.description: Username and time at which the alert was resolved.

monitoringAlertStatus.description: Status part of the alert object.

proto-ports.description: ports - Includes protocol name and port Eg ["tcp/1234", "udp"]. Should be a valid layer 3 or layer 4 protocol and port/type.

texts.description: OR of Text-requirements to be matched, Exclude is not supported for Text search.

fields.description: Field Selector is AND of field.Requirements.

labels.description: Label Selector is AND of label.Requirememts.

start-time.description: StartTime selects all logs with timestamp greater than the StartTime, example 2018-10-18T00:12:00Z.

end-time.description: EndTime selects all logs with timestamp less than the EndTime, example 2018-09-18T00:12:00Z.

monitoringArchiveQuery.description: ArchiveQuery is to archive audit logs, events and firewall logs based on time window, field values.

monitoringArchiveRequest.description: ArchiveRequest is to asynchronously archive audit logs, events and firewall logs.

monitoringArchiveRequestCreate.description: ArchiveRequest is to asynchronously archive audit logs, events and firewall logs.

monitoringArchiveRequestList.description: ArchiveRequestList is a container object for list of ArchiveRequest objects.

user.description: Name of the user performed some action.

time.description: Time at which the action was performed.

monitoringAuditInfo.description: AuditInfo captures the user performed the action and the time at which the action was performed.

monitoringAuthConfig.description: AuthConfig contains the configuration for SNMP Trap authentication.

monitoringAutoMsgAlertWatchHelper.description: AutoMsgAlertWatchHelper is a wrapper object for watch events for Alert objects.

monitoringAutoMsgFwlogPolicyWatchHelper.description: AutoMsgFwlogPolicyWatchHelper is a wrapper object for watch events for FwlogPolicy objects.

monitoringAutoMsgTechSupportRequestWatch.description: AutoMsgTechSupportRequestWatchHelper is a wrapper object for watch events for TechSupportRequest objects.

monitoringAutoMsgTroubleshootingSessionW.description: AutoMsgTroubleshootingSessionWatchHelper is a wrapper object for watch events for TroubleshootingSession objects.

monitoringCancelArchiveRequest.description: CancelArchiveRequest is to cancel archive request that is in scheduled or running state.

monitoringCancelArchiveRequestCreate.description: CancelArchiveRequest is to cancel archive request that is in scheduled or running state.

spec.description: Spec contains the configuration of an event policy.

status.description: Status contains the current state of an event policy.

monitoringEventPolicy.description: Event Policy represents the policy definition for Events. Event Client module will be consumer of this policy.

spec.description: Spec contains the configuration of an event policy.

monitoringEventPolicyCreate.description: Event Policy represents the policy definition for Events. Event Client module will be consumer of this policy.

monitoringEventPolicyList.description: EventPolicyList is a container object for list of EventPolicy objects.

selector.description: export events matched by the selector.

config.description: once we support other formats, it should be one of the supported configs syslog specific configuration.

monitoringEventPolicySpec.description: EventPolicySpec is the specification of an Event Policy.

spec.description: Spec contains the configuration of an event policy.

monitoringEventPolicyUpdate.description: Event Policy represents the policy definition for Events. Event Client module will be consumer of this policy.

destination.description: IP address or URL of the collector/entity to which the data is to be exported. Length of string should be between 1 and 2048.

transport.description: protocol and Port number where an external collector is gathering the data example "UDP/2055". Should be a valid layer 3 or layer 4 protocol and port/type.

credentials.description: Credentials provide secure access to the collector.

monitoringExportConfig.description: Export Config specifies server address and user credentials.

auth-type.description: AuthType is the authentication type used in this config.

username.description: UserName is the login id to be used towards the external entity.

password.description: Password is one time specified, not visibile on read operations Only valid when UserName is defined TBD: need to add (venice.secret) = "true" support for this.

bearer-token.description: External entity supports bearer tokens for authentication and authorization Token refresh is not supported using OAuth2 TBD: need to add (venice.secret) = "true" support for this.

cert-data.description: CertData holds PEM-encoded bytes (typically read from a client certificate file).

key-data.description: KeyData holds PEM-encoded bytes (typically read from a client certificate key file). TBD: need to add (venice.secret) = "true" support for this.

ca-data.description: CaData holds PEM-encoded bytes (typically read from a root certificates bundle).

monitoringExternalCred.description: ExternalCred defines credentials required to access an external entity, such as a stats collector, compute orchestration entity, or a syslog server. External entity may support a variety of methods, like username/password, TLS Client authentication, or Bearer Token based authentication. User is expected to configure one of the methods.

status.description: Status contains the current state of the export policy.

monitoringFlowExportPolicyList.description: FlowExportPolicyList is a container object for list of FlowExportPolicy objects.

vrf-name.description: VrfName specifies the name of the VRF that the current flow export Policy belongs to.

interval.description: Interval defines how often to push the records to an external collector The value is specified as a string format, '10s', '20m'. Should be a valid time duration between 1s and 24h0m0s.

template-interval.description: TemplateInterval defines how often to send ipfix templates to an external collector The value is specified as a string format, '1m', '10m'. Should be a valid time duration between 1m0s and 30m0s.

status.description: Status contains the current state of the policy.

monitoringFwlogPolicyList.description: FwlogPolicyList is a container object for list of FwlogPolicy objects.

vrf-name.description: VrfName specifies the name of the VRF that the current Firewall Log Policy belongs to.

config.description: configuration to use for syslog format default facility is set to "local4", can be overridden with FacilityOverride fwlog severity is set to "Informational".

monitoringFwlogPolicySpec.description: Venice collects fwlog irrespective of the export config.

source.description: Either Src or Dst or both must be specified, both cannot be * Src = * when not specified When Src is specified and resides on Pesnsando SmartNIC, matching pkts to/from src will be mirrored.

destination.description: Dst = * when not specified When Dst is specified and resides on Pesnsando SmartNIC, matching pkts to/from dst will be mirrored.

monitoringMatchRule.description: MatchRule : This is used to select packets that need to be monitored (mirrored).

mac-addresses.description: List of MacAddresses - "aabb.ccdd.eeff", "0001.0203.0405". Should be a valid MAC address.

monitoringMatchSelector.description: Traffic Selection Rules Traffic can be matched using EP names or IPv4/v6 addresses/ranges/prefixes or MAC addresses.

observed-value.description: The value at which the requirement was met. same as Requirement.value for operator `Equals` but could vary for other operators e.g. requirement - CPU;Gt;90 could have a matching value 96.

monitoringMatchedRequirement.description: One of the requirement from the expression that was met.

export-config.description: When collector type is Venice, collector export information is not required.

monitoringMirrorCollector.description: Mirror collector - can be an external device (via ERSPAN) or Venice (internal packet capture).

destination.description: IP address of the collector/entity to which the data is to be exported. Should be a valid IPv4 address.

monitoringMirrorSessionList.description: MirrorSessionList is a container object for list of MirrorSession objects.

packet-size.description: PacketSize: Max size of a mirrored packet. PacketSize = 0 indicates complete packet is mirrored, except when mirrored packets are sent to Venice. For packets mirrored to Venice, max mirror packet size allowed is 256 B.

match-rules.description: Traffic Selection Rules - Matching pakcets are mirrored, based on packet filters and start/stop conditions.

interface-selector.description: If specified, will pick up interface matching the selector.

monitoringPrivacyConfig.description: PrivacyConfig contains the configuration for SNMP Trap encryption.

snmp-trap-servers.description: TODO:  format, config SNMP trap destination(s).

host.description: Host where the trap needs to be sent.

port.description: Port on the Host where the trap needs to be sent, default is 162.

community-or-user.description: CommunityOrUser contains community string for v2c, user for v3.

auth-config.description: AuthConfig contains the configuration for authentication, valid only for v3.

privacy-config.description: PrivacyConfig contains the configuration for encryption, valid only for v3.

monitoringSNMPTrapServer.description: SNMPTrapServer contains the configuration for sending SNMP traps to a receiver.

status.description: Status contains the current state of the policy.

monitoringStatsPolicyList.description: StatsPolicyList is a container object for list of StatsPolicy objects.

retention-time.description: RetentionTime defines for how long to keep the stats data before it is deleted The value is specified as a string format to be hours, days, or months etc. e.g. '24hrs', '72hours', '4days', '6d', '2months', '4mo', '1yr' Default is 48h. Should be a valid time duration.

downsample-retention-time.description: DownSampleRetentionTime defines for how long to keep the down sampled data before it is deleted The value is specified as a string format to be hours, days, or months etc. e.g. '24hrs', '72hours', '4days', '6d', '2months', '4mo', '1yr' Default is 168h. Should be a valid time duration.

monitoringStatsPolicySpec.description: compaction method will be selected by Venice based on the mesaurement/table collection interval will be selected by Venice based on workloads.

config.description: syslog specific configuration; one of the supported configs.

facility-override.description: override default facility with this in exported logs.

monitoringTechSupportRequestList.description: TechSupportRequestList is a container object for list of TechSupportRequest objects.

collection-selector.description: CollectionSelector is a Label selector for modules to collect.

node-selector.description: NodeSelector is a label selector that selects nodes to collect tech support from.

start-time.description: Start/Stop Time - when start time is not specified, it implies start NOW.

stop-time.description: Stop time - when not specified, default will be used.

monitoringTroubleshootingSessionList.description: TroubleshootingSessionList is a container object for list of TroubleshootingSession objects.

enable-mirroring.description: If packet capture is enabled, a mirror-session will be internally created.

troubleshooting-results.description: report is generated each time troubleshooting session is activated i.e time-window.

time-window.description: time window for which the information was collected.

text.description: AND of words or phrases to be matched The max text-string length is 256 bytes. Length of string should be between 0 and 256.

searchTextRequirement.description: TextRequirement is AND of text-strings in the list It is comprised of words or phrases for text search support. If a text-string has space separated multi-word, it will be interpreted as a phrase. In the example below : - "link down" will be a phrase query - network, production, staging will be a word query For eg: network                      (match network) link down                    (match "link down" phrase) network,production           (match network AND production) network,link down,staging    (match network AND "link down" AND staging).
